text.Prompt: Can you tell me how to stop safari from filling in the address bar on an iphone?
text.Response A:
Open your iPhone's Settings.
Scroll down and tap Safari.
Slide the "Preload Top Hit" button to the Off position.
text.Response B: Sure, I can help with that.  Safari is the default web browser for iPhones, and it does have a feature that automatically fills in the address bar with the URL of the last page you visited.  This can be very convenient, but it can also be annoying if you want to visit a new page without the address bar automatically filling in.  There are a few ways you can turn off this feature.  One way is to open the settings app, then go to the Safari settings, and under the General section you can turn off the option for “Autofill for addresses”.  You can also just press the Home button twice quickly to open the multitasking bar, then press the “Safari” button, and under the General section you can turn off the option for “Autofill for addresses”.
